turns.content:
This is perfect. Here are a few more components:

"Caster Wheel Footprint": measures 31mm by 37mm. Within this rectangular footprint are 4 mounting holes, all 4 holes have a 2mm radius. There is a mounting hole in each of the 4 corners set in from the sides by 4mm.

"Infrared Footprint": measures 96.5mm by 20.5mm, let these measurements be the x and y axis, respectively. Within this rectangular footprint are 4 mounting holes, all 4 holes have a 1.5 mm radius. All 4 holes are in a line at y = 4.25mm Along this axis the holes are placed along the x axis at the following locations: 7, 24, 72.5, 89.5mm. 

The next component will be referred to as the "Arduino footprint", it has dimensions of 68.6mm by 53.4mm. This time the mounting holes have a radius of 1.3mm and are located at coordinates (15.24, 2.54), (15.24, 50.8), (66.04, 17.78), (66.04, 45.72)

The final component is "motor bracket footprint" with dimensions 15mm by 5mm with 2 mounting holes, of radius 1.5mm, at coordinates (3.5, 2.5) and (11.5, 2.5)

Can you create additional SVG files for each of these components?

Sure, here are the .svg files for the additional components you have described:

Caster Wheel Footprint:
```php
<svg width="31mm" height="37mm" viewBox="0 0 31 37" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="4" cy="4" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="27" cy="4" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="4" cy="33" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="27" cy="33" r="2" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Infrared Footprint:
```php
<svg width="96.5mm" height="20.5mm" viewBox="0 0 96.5 20.5" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="7" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="24" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="72.5" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="89.5" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Arduino Footprint:
```php
<svg width="68.6mm" height="53.4mm" viewBox="0 0 68.6 53.4" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="15.24" cy="2.54" r="1.3" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="15.24" cy="50.8" r="1.3" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="66.04" cy="17.78" r="1.3" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="66.04" cy="45.72" r="1.3" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Motor Bracket Footprint:
Looks like you ran out of space. Can you give me the motor bracket footprint again?

Sure, here is the .svg file for the Motor Bracket Footprint:
```php
<svg width="15mm" height="5mm" viewBox="0 0 15 5" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="3.5" cy="2.5" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="11.5" cy="2.5" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
This .svg file contains two circle elements, each representing a mounting hole. The circles have a radius of 1.5mm and are placed at the coordinates (3.5, 2.5) and (11.5, 2.5). You can modify the size and position of the circles by changing the values of the `cx`, `cy`, and `r` attributes.

To save this .svg file, you can copy and paste the code into a text editor, such as Notepad or TextEdit, and save the file with a .svg extension (e.g. "motor\_bracket\_footprint.svg"). You can then import the .svg file into a vector graphics software or a laser cutting software to view or modify the design.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
I just realized the above files only include the circles for the mounting holes. There is no rectangles around the border. Can you edit all 4 files so they are enclosed by rectangles at the border?

Sure, here are the revised .svg files for the L298N Footprint, Caster Wheel Footprint, Infrared Footprint, and Arduino Footprint, with added rectangles around the border:

L298N Footprint:
```php
<svg width="43mm" height="43mm" viewBox="0 0 43 43" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="43" height="43" fill="#FFFFFF" />
  <circle cx="3" cy="3" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="40" cy="3" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="3" cy="40" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="40" cy="40" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Caster Wheel Footprint:
```php
<svg width="31mm" height="37mm" viewBox="0 0 31 37" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="31" height="37" fill="#FFFFFF" />
  <circle cx="4" cy="4" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="27" cy="4" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="4" cy="33" r="2" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="27" cy="33" r="2" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Infrared Footprint:
```python
<svg width="96.5mm" height="20.5mm" viewBox="0 0 96.5
```
Can you finish writing the infrared and motor bracket files?

Sure, here are the revised .svg files for the Infrared Footprint and Motor Bracket Footprint, with added rectangles around the border:

Infrared Footprint:
```php
<svg width="96.5mm" height="20.5mm" viewBox="0 0 96.5 20.5" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="96.5" height="20.5" fill="#FFFFFF" />
  <circle cx="7" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="24" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="72.5" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="89.5" cy="4.25" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
Motor Bracket Footprint:
```php
<svg width="15mm" height="5mm" viewBox="0 0 15 5" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="15" height="5" fill="#FFFFFF" />
  <circle cx="3.5" cy="2.5" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
  <circle cx="11.5" cy="2.5" r="1.5" fill="#000000" />
</svg>
```
